intro: Gagea amblyopetala var. calabra, commonly known as the Calabrian gagea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its small, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
